DOC.brief_title: Moving Forward : A Weight Loss Intervention African-American Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize study 300 African American ( AA ) breast cancer survivor conduct Chicago Park District ( CPD ) facility . The study base six predominantly AA community Chicago ( Roseland , Pullman , Englewood , Chatham , Austin , South Shore , Woodlawn , Calumet Heights , North Lawndale Grand Crossing ) . These community least one CPD fitness center , population least 90 % AA similar socioeconomic status . Fifty AA breast cancer survivor recruit community ( 25 treatment/ 25 control ) . The Moving Forward intervention integrate concept Social Cognitive Theory ( SCT ) Socio-Ecological Model ( SEM ) promote independent behavior change . SCT suggest behavior explain dynamic interaction behavior , personal factor ( e.g. , self-efficacy ) , environment ( e.g , social support ) . Self-efficacy person 's confidence perform particular behavior overcome barrier behavior . A number study support mediate role self-efficacy make independent health behavior change . The overall goal Moving Forward make independent change health behavior promote healthy weight . The weight loss goal consistent recommendation expert panel National Institutes Health ( NIH ) . Dietary goal aim produce weight loss , decrease BC recurrence risk , improve overall health include 1 ) decrease daily caloric intake ( base weight pound X 12 kcal/day 500-750 calorie subtract create energy deficit ) ; 2 ) decrease dietary fat consumption 20 % total calorie ; 3 ) increase fruit vegetable consumption 7 daily serving ; 4 ) increase fiber 25 gram per day . For exercise , participant gradually increase activity minimum 180 minute per week 55-65 % maximal heart rate .
